insurer_name: Highway Insurance Company Limited (trading as Allianz)
coverage_summary: Home insurance covering the cost of repairing or rebuilding your home and/or replacing its contents following certain unforeseen events such as fire, storm, flood, theft and escape of water. This is a Broker Rainbow Home Insurance product offering Buildings Cover, Contents Cover, or both, with optional additional covers.
key_inclusions: Buildings structure including garages and domestic outbuildings
Accidental breakage of windows and sanitaryware (Buildings)
Tracing source of escape of water and wall repairs during investigation
Home Emergencies including call out charges and labour (up to £500)
Household goods and personal belongings in home, garage and outbuildings (Contents)
Accidental damage to televisions and mirrors (Contents)
key_exclusions: Maintenance, wear and tear or damage that happens gradually over time
Storm or flood damage to fences, gates and hedges
Money and pedal cycles stolen from home unless force and violence was used to gain entry (Contents cover)
Damage caused by chewing, scratching, tearing or fouling by domestic pets
Damage that occurred before policy start date
Malicious acts, vandalism, theft, escape or loss of water, leakage or loss of oil, breakage of glass or sanitaryware, frost, or contents in the garden if home is unoccupied for more than 60 days

coverage_limits.home_emergencies: Up to £500 including call out charges and labour
coverage_limits.sum_insured: As confirmed in quote, Policy Document and Policy Schedule (specific amounts not stated in IPID)

sub_limits.matching_undamaged_items: Up to 50% for replacing undamaged or unbroken items when damage occurs in a clearly identifiable area and exact matches are not possible
sub_limits.temporarily_removed_contents: Limited cover for contents temporarily removed from home for up to 90 days in Great Britain, Northern Ireland, Isle of Man or Channel Islands

special_conditions: Home must not be left unoccupied for more than 60 days (loss of certain coverages)
Buildings, contents and personal property must be kept in sound condition and good repair
Full and accurate information must be provided during application
Any information changes during policy period must be reported

Storm damage only covered where wind speeds are at least 47mph/75kmh or torrential rainfall at least 25mm/one inch per hour or snow depth at least one foot/30cm in 24 hours or hail of intensity causing damage to hard surfaces or breaking glass
Damaged contents or building parts must be retained for inspection
Cannot negotiate, admit fault, or make offer/promise/payment without written consent in event of claim
excess_deductible: Policy excess applies (specific amounts confirmed in Policy Schedule - not stated in IPID)
geographical_coverage: Buildings and Contents: Property location and within boundaries of land. Contents temporarily removed: Great Britain, Northern Ireland, Isle of Man, Channel Islands (up to 90 days). Personal Possessions (if chosen): Anywhere in the world
pre_existing_conditions: Damage that has happened before the start of the policy is not covered
cancellation_policy: Customer can cancel at any time by writing, emailing or calling intermediary. Within 14 days of start/renewal date or receipt of policy documents (whichever is later): Full refund for unused period. After 14 days (no claim made): Charged for period of cover provided. If claim made during policy period: Full annual premium must be paid, no refund available.

endorsements.coverage_impact: Broadens coverage beyond named perils for buildings

endorsements.name: Accidental Damage to Contents
endorsements.description: Extends contents cover to include accidental damage beyond standard perils
endorsements.coverage_impact: Broadens coverage beyond named perils for contents

endorsements.name: Personal Possessions away from home
endorsements.description: Covers loss or damage to personal possessions when away from the home
endorsements.coverage_impact: Provides worldwide cover for personal possessions outside the home

endorsements.name: Family Legal Protection
endorsements.coverage_impact: Adds legal protection cover up to £100,000

claims_requirements.notification_timeframe: As soon as reasonably possible after the incident
required_documents: Retained damaged contents or building parts for inspection
process_steps: Tell insurer as soon as reasonably possible
Provide full details of the incident
Retain any damaged contents or parts of buildings for inspection
Do not negotiate, admit fault or make any offer, promise or payment without written consent
claims_requirements.evidence_requirements: Damaged contents or parts of buildings must be retained so insurer may inspect them
claims_requirements.claims_contact: Contact through intermediary (specific contact details not provided in IPID)

eligibility_criteria.residency_requirements: Property must be located in Great Britain, Northern Ireland, Isle of Man or Channel Islands
other_restrictions: Property must not be left unoccupied for more than 60 days without notification
Must maintain buildings, contents and personal property in sound condition and good repair
Must provide full and accurate information during application

policy_definitions.unoccupied: Home left empty/uninhabited for more than 60 days (results in loss of certain coverages)
policy_definitions.storm: Wind speeds of at least 47mph/75kmh OR torrential rainfall at rate of at least 25mm/one inch per hour OR snow to depth of at least one foot/30cm in 24 hours OR hail of such intensity that it causes damage to hard surfaces or breaks glass
policy_definitions.buildings: The structure of your home, its garages or domestic outbuildings within the boundaries of your land, plus permanent fixtures and fittings
policy_definitions.contents: Household goods and personal belongings in your home, garage and any domestic outbuildings within the boundaries of your land
policy_definitions.personal possessions: Items covered under optional Personal Possessions cover when away from home
policy_definitions.intermediary: The broker or agent through whom the policy is arranged
policy_definitions.within the boundaries of your land: Property must be within the defined boundaries of the insured property location

time_sensitive_requirements.notification_deadlines: As soon as reasonably possible after an incident for claims. Must notify of any information changes during policy period.
time_sensitive_requirements.cooling_off_period: 14 days from start/renewal date or receipt of policy documents, whichever is later, for full refund of unused cover

common_questions.question: What happens if I leave my home empty for a holiday?
common_questions.answer: You won't be covered for malicious acts, vandalism, theft, escape or loss of water, leakage or loss of oil, breakage of glass or sanitaryware, frost or contents in the garden if your home is left unoccupied for more than 60 days. For shorter periods, cover continues as normal.
common_questions.section_reference: Are there any restrictions on cover?

common_questions.question: Are my fence and gates covered if damaged in a storm?
common_questions.answer: No, storm or flood damage to fences, gates and hedges is specifically excluded from cover.

common_questions.question: Can I get a refund if I cancel my policy?
common_questions.answer: Yes, if you cancel within 14 days of start/renewal or receiving documents (whichever is later), you get a full refund for unused cover. After 14 days with no claim, you're charged only for the period covered. However, if you've made a claim, you must pay the full annual premium with no refund.
common_questions.section_reference: How do I cancel the contract?

common_questions.question: Is my bicycle covered if stolen from my home?
common_questions.answer: Pedal cycles are covered within the home under Contents Cover. However, if stolen, the theft is only covered if force and violence was used to gain entry to the home. For broader cycle cover away from home, Personal Possessions cover would be needed.
common_questions.section_reference: What is insured? / What is not insured?

common_questions.question: What defines a storm for claims purposes?
common_questions.answer: A storm is only covered where wind speeds are at least 47mph/75kmh or torrential rainfall at a rate of at least 25mm/one inch per hour or snow to a depth of at least one foot/30cm in 24 hours or hail of such intensity that it causes damage to hard surfaces or breaks glass.
common_questions.section_reference: Are there any restrictions on cover?

common_questions.question: Am I covered for damage caused by my pet?
common_questions.answer: No, damage caused by chewing, scratching, tearing or fouling by domestic pets is specifically excluded.

common_questions.question: If I need to replace items and can't match them exactly, will you pay for all items to match?
common_questions.answer: No, if damage occurs in a clearly identifiable area and exact replacements cannot be matched, you will only be covered for up to 50% for replacing any undamaged or unbroken items.
common_questions.section_reference: Are there any restrictions on cover?

common_questions.question: Are my belongings covered when I take them on holiday abroad?
common_questions.answer: Contents have limited cover when temporarily removed from home for up to 90 days, but only in Great Britain, Northern Ireland, Isle of Man or Channel Islands. For worldwide cover, you would need to add the Personal Possessions optional cover.

common_questions.question: What is included in Home Emergencies cover?
common_questions.answer: Home Emergencies cover includes call out charges and labour up to £500 for emergency situations.

common_questions.question: Do I need to tell you if something changes during my policy?
common_questions.answer: Yes, you must tell the insurer if any of the information you provided during application changes during the period of insurance. This is one of your key obligations.
